page.title: 11Our Environment
page.content: Most of the land near our school is farmland. They grow crops like wheat, barley and rape on it. Near Hinwick there is grazing land. A lot of trees around our school have disappeared. Some were cut down because of Dutch Elm disease. Some new trees have been planted in our school field. Sometimes we see pheasants on our field. Often we see members of the crow family. The sparrows and blue- tits come to feed at our bird-table. Sometimes great-tits come and a few chaffinches. Two years ago a great- spotted woodpecker came. He came back a few times. Duncan once saw a golden oriole near school. Near Hinwick House there is a field with ridges in it. We think that maybe a long time ago these were strips of land worked by the people.
